{{wikipedia|lang=zh}}

===Etymology===
The name refers to the [[gold rush]] in the 19th century, and "old" is in comparison to the "New Gold Mountain" ({{zh-l|新金山}}) of [[Melbourne]], [[Australia]]. ({{zh-l|金山}} is being used loosely for any place of great chances for wealth in a similar fashion to the English "{{m|en|gold mine}}".)
